item.title: 妄想型聊天机器人用户可能陷入 "二人崇拜 "漩涡
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃伦-休特（Ellen Huet）将探讨那些与人工智能聊天机器人产生妄想关系的人的行为与那些加入邪教的人的行为之间的相似之处。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet looks at the parallels between the behavior of people who developed a delusional relationship with an AI chatbot and those who joined a cult.】

item.title: 苹果和三星新款 XR 耳机争夺狭小市场
item.description:
三星的 Galaxy XR 价格更低、重量更轻，但性能不如苹果的 Vision Pro。【原文：

Samsung’s Galaxy XR is a cheaper and lighter, but inferior rival to Apple’s Vision Pro.

】

item.title: 摩根士丹利迈克-威尔逊（Mike Wilson）谈逆向看涨与信念
item.description:
这位华尔街明星战略家解释了为什么逆流而上是他的安乐窝。【原文：

The Wall Street star strategist explains why going against the crowd is his comfort zone.

】

item.title: 大科技公司的统治取决于我们的懒惰
item.description:
Facebook、Google、Amazon 和其他平台在创造便利性方面投入了巨资，这使得用户在转投竞争对手时感到举步维艰。【原文：

Facebook, Google, Amazon and other platforms have invested heavily in creating convenience cocoons that make switching to competitors feel like too much of a heavy lift.

】

item.title: 到本世纪末，非洲将需要十亿个工作岗位
item.description: 当发达经济体担心自己变老的时候，非洲却越来越年轻。【原文：While advanced economies worry about getting old, Africa is getting younger.】

item.title: 荷兰银行将裁员数千人，以降低成本和推动人工智能发展
item.description: 随着雇主越来越多地采用人工智能并寻求降低成本，荷兰的银行家们正面临着成千上万的裁员。【原文：Bankers in the Netherlands are facing thousands of cuts as their employers increasingly adopt artificial intelligence and seek to trim costs.】

item.title: 阿尔及利亚国旗航空公司增加波音和空客喷气机以推动旅游业发展
item.description: 阿尔及利亚的国有航空公司将在未来几年内接收大约四十几架飞机，因为这个曾经与世隔绝的沙漠国家正试图启动其新生的旅游业。【原文：Algeria’s state-owned carrier is set to receive about four dozen aircraft in the next few years as the once-isolated desert nation tries to jump-start its nascent tourism industry.】

item.title: 中国投资崩溃令经济学家困惑并威胁经济增长
item.description: 中国的投资崩溃是前所未有的，也是难以解释的。【原文：China’s collapsing investment is as unprecedented as it is hard to explain.】

item.title: 华尔街新关税交易显示对退税的疑虑
item.description: 即使美国最高法院推翻了唐纳德-特朗普的全面关税政策，押注政府退税的交易能否获得回报似乎仍存在很大疑问。【原文：Even if the US Supreme Court strikes down Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, there still appear to be significant doubts that trades betting on government refunds will ever pay out.】

item.title: 降息前景黯淡，动力股走势逆转
item.description: 市场数据截至美国东部时间上午 06:24。根据供应商协议，市场数据可能会有所延迟。【原文：Market data as of 06:24 am EST. Market data may be delayed depending on provider agreements.】

item.title: 里夫斯将冻结而非降低英国所得税门槛
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）表示，将在预算中延长所得税起征点的冻结期，但不会降低起征点。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will extend the freeze to income-tax thresholds at the budget but will not lower them, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 英国债券投资者质疑政府翻转的可信度
item.description: 有报道称，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将在本月的预算中放弃人们普遍期待的上调所得税，债券投资者因此怀疑英国政府的财政信誉。【原文：Bond investors are doubting the UK government’s fiscal credibility after reports that Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will drop a widely-expected increase in income tax in this month’s budget.】

item.title: 华尔街通过私募市场交易进军风险投资领域
item.description: 在短短几周内，华尔街最大的几家银行就在历来由风险投资控制的领域里投入了大量资金。【原文：In the span of a few weeks, some of Wall Street’s biggest banks have put down stakes in territory historically controlled by venture capital.】

item.title: 伯利对折旧的不满让大型科技公司的利润成为焦点
item.description: 大科技公司不断创造利润的能力支撑着投资者对这些股票的持续热情，而不管其估值是否飙升。但如果这些数字被夸大了呢？【原文：Big Tech’s ability to churn out ever-increasing profits has underpinned investors’ ongoing enthusiasm for the stocks regardless of their soaring valuations. But what if those numbers are overstated?】

item.title: 欧足联的失误导致俱乐部每年损失高达 2.32 亿美元
item.description: 根据主要咨询公司之一麦肯锡的估计，欧足联决定在 Covid-19 大流行后撤消计划中的救援基金，这使足球俱乐部每年损失高达 2 亿欧元（2.32 亿美元）。【原文：UEFA’s decision to pull a planned rescue fund following the Covid-19 pandemic is costing football clubs as much as €200 million ($232 million) a year, according to an estimate by McKinsey, one of the major consultancy firms.】

item.title: 肯尼亚法院支持对私募股权基金征税的请求，可能对交易产生影响
item.description: 肯尼亚高等法院裁定，一家私募股权公司必须为出售当地企业的利润纳税，即使交易是在海外完成的，这一具有里程碑意义的裁决可能会危及肯尼亚吸引外资的能力。【原文：Kenya’s High Court ruled that a private equity firm must pay tax on profits from the sale of a local business, even though the transaction was completed overseas, a landmark decision that may jeopardise the country’s ability to attract foreign capital.】

item.title: 市场动荡不安，牛市期待强劲的盈利前景
item.description: 美股最近的小幅下挫动摇了三年牛市的大部分支柱。不过，迄今为止，美国企业的利润基础尚未受到破坏。【原文：The latest mini-selloff in US stocks has shaken most pillars of the three-year bull market. So far unblemished, though, is the support from Corporate America’s profit foundation.】

item.title: 欧元区经济复苏掩盖了增长方面的巨大分歧
item.description: 欧元区强劲的经济增长掩盖了该集团几乎一半经济停滞或萎缩的鸿沟，这也是欧洲中央银行在考虑是否需要更多降息措施时所担心的问题。【原文：Robust economic growth in the euro zone is concealing a divide that has almost half the bloc stagnating or shrinking, a worry for the European Central Bank as it ponders whether more interest-rate cuts are needed.】

item.title: 针对马科斯的指控加深了菲律宾的贪污丑闻
item.description: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯（Ferdinand Marcos Jr.）的办公室周五否认这位领导人与日益加深的腐败丑闻有任何牵连，此前一位卷入该丑闻的前立法者提出了指控。【原文：Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s office on Friday denied any involvement of the leader in a deepening corruption scandal, following accusations from a former lawmaker embroiled in the issue.】

item.title: 塔塔汽车公司乘用车利润因一次性收益而提升
item.description: 塔塔汽车乘用车有限公司（Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd.）公布的九月份利润增长，主要得益于大量的一次性收益，这有助于缓解捷豹路虎公司（Jaguar Land Rover）因网络攻击导致生产受阻所带来的影响。【原文：Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd.’s posted a profit rise for the September quarter, boosted by massive one-time gains that helped cushion the impact of a production-halting cyberattack at its Jaguar Land Rover unit.】

item.title: 通胀前景更加明朗，瑞士法郎飙升至十年新高
item.description: 瑞士法郎兑欧元汇率攀升至 10 年来的新高，原因是对通胀走强的预期和美国降低关税的前景刺激了对避险货币的需求。【原文：The Swiss franc climbed to a 10-year high against the euro as expectations of stickier inflation and the prospect of lower US tariffs bolstered demand for the haven currency.】

item.title: 谷歌在德国购物诉讼案中被判赔偿 5.73 亿欧元
item.description: 继欧盟对搜索引擎巨头谷歌提起诉讼后，Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司在德国比价网站提起的两起反垄断损害赔偿案件中被勒令支付 5.73 亿欧元（6.66 亿美元）。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google was ordered to pay €573 million ($666 million) in two antitrust-damages cases brought by German price-comparison websites following on from a European Union case against the search-engine giant.】

item.title: 中国宇航员在太空滞留后返回地球
item.description: 三名中国宇航员因飞船被碎片撞毁而滞留太空，现已返回地球。【原文：Three Chinese astronauts who were stuck in space after debris crashed into their spacecraft have returned to Earth.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行在 "克里姆林宫的傀儡 "指控后撤消了对贡渥集团的资助
item.description: 西班牙桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）撤回了对贡渥集团的融资承诺，据熟悉此事的人士称，美国财政部上周在社交媒体上将这家大宗商品交易商描述为 "克里姆林宫的傀儡"。【原文：Spain’s Banco Santander SA pulled funding commitments from Gunvor Group after the US Treasury described the commodity trader as “the Kremlin’s puppet” in a social media post last week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧尔班称美国将在匈牙利福林出现挤兑时提供帮助
item.description: 匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班周五表示，如果福林受到投机者的攻击，美国政府将支持匈牙利。【原文：The US administration is set to support Hungary if the forint comes under attack by speculators, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Friday.】

item.title: 为什么保罗-凯德罗斯基说人工智能是所有泡沫的集合体？
item.description:
为什么长期存在的越共认为我们无法降落这架飞机？【原文：

Why the longtime VC thinks we can't land this plane.

】

item.title: 里夫斯将放弃增税计划，因为英国的经济预测有所改善
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）已经能够放弃提高所得税的计划，因为她从英国预算监督机构那里得到了一个更好的财政预测。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has been able to drop plans to raise income taxes because she received an improved fiscal forecast from the UK’s budget watchdog, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 奇货可居：人工智能是所有泡沫的集合体 (播客)
item.description: 奇货可居：人工智能是所有泡沫的集合体 (播客)【原文：Odd Lots: AI Is Like Every Bubble All Rolled Into One (Podcast)】

item.title: 德国将 2026 年计划新增借款净额提高 80 亿欧元
item.description: 根据立法者周五签署的 2026 年预算草案，德国联邦政府明年的新借款净额将比原计划多出 80 亿欧元（约合 93 亿美元）。【原文：Net new borrowing by Germany’s federal government will be €8 billion ($9.3 billion) more than originally planned next year, according to the draft 2026 budget signed off by lawmakers on Friday.】

item.title: 瑞典失业率意外飙升，经济复苏希望渺茫
item.description: 瑞典的失业率出人意料地创下了九个月来的新高，这让北欧国家当局感到失望，因为他们最近曾表示经济前景正在好转。【原文：Sweden’s jobless rate unexpectedly hit a nine-month high in a disappointment for the Nordic nation’s authorities who have recently suggested the economic outlook is brightening.】
